narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: A Broad and Detailed Understanding of Human-Environment Interactions

The structure of the course and focused topic discussions each week. The reading responses helped to process the readings and formulate opinions on them. The class lectures drew together eclectic sources that related to the weekly topic.
The class discussions. This is where I learned the most.
The readings and class discussions
I enjoyed the case studies and felt that they were very useful in understanding how cliamte and society effect one another.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am an anthropologist who is interested in Human Ecology, Cultural Ecology and Historical Ecology. And this course exposed me to different theories on Human-Environment Interaction through times and through space.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: As an anthropologist who is interested in Human Ecology, Cultural Ecology and Historical Ecology, I was interested in the different theories on Human-Environment Interaction through times and through space that this course offers.
To process some questions I have about the relationship between humans and the non-human environment. Also, Professor Dove is a great interpreter and instructor.
I wanted to have a better understanding for how climate and society were related. I definitely achieved this goal!
To fulfill a program requirement, but also because the course looked very interesting with regards to the relationship between climate and society.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Very much so.
Yes
Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Being able to learn how other individuals assess a topic, and how they agree or disagree.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Keep up with the readings and don't start the paper too late!
I would definitely recommend this course for those interested in a foundation in climate anthropology.
